sentences.english: Moonlight Senran, spirit temperament, everything is just a mirage, transient.
sentences.chinese: 月光的森然，乐律的精魂，一切只是幻影，稍纵即逝。

sentences.english: See Chapter Two for more discussions on the merits of various temperaments.
sentences.chinese: 详见第二章对于变化的乐律优点的讨论。

sentences.english: Zhu Zaiyu in Ming Dynasty contributed to the research on theory of music temperament.
sentences.chinese: 明代朱载堉在乐律学研究方面有着重要的贡献。

sentences.english: To be an excellent singer, one must comprehend words of a song and its temperament deeply.
sentences.chinese: 作为优秀歌手，对歌词和乐律要有深刻了解。

definition: music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
pre-Tang names of the five notes of the pentatonic scale, corresponding roughly to do, re, mi, sol, la
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers

five notes of pentatonic scale, roughly do, re, mi, sol, la/five classes of initial consonants of Chinese phonetics, namely: 喉音[hou2 yin1], 牙音[ya2 yin1], 舌音[she2 yin1], 齒音|齿音[chi3 yin1], 唇音[chun2 yin1]
